content: navajo plying and pirate wench pulse warmer pattern learning how to spin is exciting but if you re anything like me you ll want to move on to the next step as soon as possible i loved the idea of navajo plying but i lost patience spinning up lace weight singles since i didn t have a full spindle and navajo plying uses up so much single i was left with a whopping 11 yards of lovely worsted weight yarn i whipped up this quick little cuff with just barely enough yarn to spare it s rustic laced up appearance made me think instantly of pirate women i probably read too much this pdf will teach you how to navajo ply yarn and gives you something to do with all those mini-skiens just want to learn how to navajo ply that s fine don t want to bother with the tutorial and just want the pattern scroll on down it s wonderfully simple and only takes a few minutes of course you don t need to use navajo plied hand spun yarn to make it any worsted weight yarn will do ps if you really love this pattern and/or tutorial go and donate however much you d expect to pay for it to a good cause whether that s a small local organization or a huge international one it s a good deed even little bits help go on then how to navajo ply spin up a thin single i spun an undyed wool blend into about a lace to sport weight note for the pulse warmer--i used herb and spice dyed wool for the tutorial when you ve run out of patience spinning the single but have a fair amount on the spindle wind you single off onto an empty toilet paper tube or if you re feeling fancy a nostepinne anything with a thumb-sized or larger circumference that is longer than four inches or so should work fine tie your single onto the hook of your spindle in the hand you don t use to spin your spindle hold your singles and unwind as much as you can before the spindle hits the ground or just a decently long length hold the spindle with your legs or feet and fold the single you ve just unwound into three equal sections put the loop that forms at the bottom on the hook of the spindle and spin in the plying direction the opposite of the direction you spun your single stop the spindle when the singles have twisted together test for balance by holding the end near your single up to the hook if it twists on itself ply some more or let out some twist by spinning the spindle in the direction you spun your
